intro: Hibbertia pubens, commonly known as the hairy hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal and heathland areas. Hibbertia pubens has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
